Key Match Events: Christian Bethancourt drove in seven runs, including a go-ahead two-run single in the ninth, as the Chicago Cubs rallied past the Pittsburgh Pirates 14-10 on Wednesday to sweep a three-game series.
Pete Crow-Armstrong had a career-high four hits to boost his batting average over his last 21 games to.341 (26 of 76)
Post-Match Reflections: Pirates manager Derek Shelton fumed after the collapse, admitting "I don’t know if I’ve been as (angry) as I am right now."

Cubs: RHP Ben Brown (neck strain) is unlikely to return this season. Brown, who has been out since June 11, has been rehabbing in Arizona but has not restarted a pitching program.... RHP Ethan Roberts exited with ankle soreness after pitching 1 1/3 innings of relief.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs scored 41 runs across three games at PNC Park to improve to 17-8 over their last 25 games to move two games above.500 (68-66) for the first time since May 25 and stay on the fringe of contention for a wild-card playoff spot.
